alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 1:07PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG CONTINUES THIS AFTERNOON... Locally dense fog will persist at least through the next couple of hours across parts of central Wisconsin, including Wisconsin Highway 29. Visibilities will be locally reduced to under 1/2 mile at times. While there may be brief improvement as scattered rain showers move through in the next few hours, there will be redevelopment of fog this evening. This redevelopment of fog is expected to persist through tonight and could be become dense. Motorists should be prepared for poor visibilities while traveling today. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
